all in good time.translation[0].definiti: used when someone wants to do something soon but you want to wait a little
‘When can we open our presents, Mum?’ ‘All in good time, Billy.’
all in good time.translation[1].definiti: used to tell someone to be patient because something they are waiting for will certainly happen after a period of time, and probably quite soon
‘I’d love to see it.’ ‘All in good time.’
